hypeerweb

Class SimplifiedNodeDomain

  • java.lang.Object
    • hypeerweb.SimplifiedNodeDomain
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpectedResult

    public class SimplifiedNodeDomain
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the information for a node needed for automatic testing. Do NOT assume that the domain of this class is the domain of the connections of a node. downPointers are also known as surrogateNeighbors upPointers are also known as edgeNodes 
      Domain:
      webId:                int
      height:               int
      neighbors:            Set
      upPointers:           Set
      downPointers:         Set
      fold:                 int
      surrogateFold:        int
      inverseSurrogateFold: int
    Author:
    Scott Woodfield

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimplifiedNodeDomain

        public SimplifiedNodeDomain(int webId,
                    int height,
                    java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> neighbors,
                    java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> upPointers,
                    java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> downPointers,
                    int fold,
                    int surrogateFold,
                    int inverseSurrogateFold)
        Initializes the domain from the connections of the node.
        Parameters:
        webId - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new webId.
        height - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new height.
        neighbors - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new neighbors.
        upPointers - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new upPointers.
        downPointers - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new downPointers.
        fold - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new fold.
        surrogateFold - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new surrogateFold.
        inverseSurrogateFold - the simplifiedNodeDomain's new inverseSurrogateFold.
        Precondition:
        neighbors != null AND
        upPointers != null AND
        downPointers != null AND
        Postcondition:
        this.webId = webId AND
        this.height = height AND
        this.neighbors = neighbors AND
        this.upPointers = upPointers AND
        this.downPointers = downPointers AND
        this.fold = fold AND
        this.surrogateFold = surrogateFold AND
        this.inverseSurrogateFold = inverseSurrogateFold In other words:
        1. The simplifiedNodeDomains webId equals the webId passed in. 1. The simplifiedNodeDomains height equals the height passed in. 2. The simplifiedNodeDomains neighbors equals the neighbors passed in. 3. The simplifiedNodeDomains upPointers equals the upPointers passed in. 4. The simplifiedNodeDomains downPointers equals the downPointers passed in. 5. The simplifiedNodeDomains fold equals the fold passed in. 6. The simplifiedNodeDomains surrogateFold equals the surrogateFold passed in. 7. The simplifiedNodeDomains inverseSurrogateFold equals the inverseSurrogateFold passed in.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String leadingCharacters)
        Returns a string representation of the SimplifiedNodeDomain with the leadingCharacters prepended to each line. 
         Format:
         Representation           ::= Node Neighbors UpPointers DownPointers Fold SurrogateFold
         Node                     ::= LeadingCharacters "Node:                 " (Non-NegativeInteger | -1)   "\n"
         Neighbors                ::= LeadingCharacters "Neighbors:            " ListOfNon-NegativeInteger    "\n"
         UpPointers               ::= LeadingCharacters "UpPointers:           " ListOfNon-NegativeInteger    "\n"
         DownPointers             ::= LeadingCharacters "DownPointers:         " ListOfNon-NegativeInteger    "\n"
         Fold                     ::= LeadingCharacters "Fold:                 " (Non-NegativeInteger | "-1") "\n"
         SurrogateFold            ::= LeadingCharacters "SurrogateFold:        " (Non-NegativeInteger | "-1") "\n"
         InverseSurrogateFold     ::= LeadingCharacters "InverseSurrogateFold: " (Non-NegativeInteger | "-1") "\n"
         LeadingCharacters ::= CHAR*
        Parameters:
        leadingCharacters - a string containing a sequence of one or more characters to be used as padding in front of the lines.
        Precondition:
        leadingCharacers != null
        Postcondition:
        result = A string with the appropriate information in the appropriate location of the format.

      • containsCloserNode

        public boolean containsCloserNode(int nextNodeId,
                         int targetId)
        Determines whether there is an id in neighbors, upPointers, downPointers, fold, surrogateFold, or inverseSurrogateFold that is closer to the targetId than the nextNodeId. Closer is defined as the number of locations in their webId's binary representation in which their respective bits differ.
        Parameters:
        nextNodeId - the id we think is as close to the target as any other node known to this node.
        targetId - the id we are computing the distance to.
        Precondition:
        None
        Postcondition:
        result = NOT ∃ nodeId ((nodeId ∈ neighbors OR nodeId ∈ upPointers OR nodeID ∈ downPointers OR
        nodeID = fold OR nodeId = surrogateFold OR nodeId = inverseSurrogateFold) AND nodeId ≥ 0 AND nodeId.distanceTo(targetId) < nextNodeId.distanceTo(targetId))

      • distanceTo

        public static int distanceTo(int thisId,
             int otherId)
        Returns the distance from thisId to otherId. This distance is the number of bits in which the two ids differ.
        Parameters:
        thisId - the first id used in the computation.
        otherId - the second id used in the computation
        Precondition:
        None
        Postcondition:
        result = NumberOf 0 ≤ i ≤ 31 (thisId.binaryRepresentation[i] != otherId.binaryRepresentation[i])
